column1: Janet's duck lays 16 eggs a day. She eats three at breakfast every morning and bakes her duck friends four eggs a day. She sells the rest at the farmers market every day for $2 per duck egg. How much money does she make in dollars a day at the farmers market?
The skirt uses 2 cords of blue thread and half that amount of white thread. How many cords does it use in total?

Josha decides to try to buy a house and sell it at a profit. He buys the house for $80,000 and spends $50,000 renovating it. This increased the value of the house by 150%. How much profit did he make?
James decides to run three short runs three times a week. He runs 60 meters for each short run. How many meters does he run in total per week?

Each day, Wendi feeds each of her hens three cups of a hybrid chicken meal, containing seeds, insects, and vegetables to help maintain their good health. She feeds the hens their food in three separate meals. In the morning, she gives her hens 15 cups of food. In the afternoon, she gives her hens another 25 cups of food. How many cups of food does she need to give her hens at the last meal of the day if Wendi's chickens number 20?

Kylar went to the store to buy some mirrors for her new building. One mirror costs $5, but each second mirror costs only 60% of the price. Kylar wants to buy 16 mirrors. How much does she have to pay for those mirrors?
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston. Charleston has 4 times as many sheep as Seattle. How many sheep do Toulouse, Charleston, and Seattle have in total if Seattle has 20 sheep?

Carla downloads a 200 GB file. Normally she can download 2 GB every minute, but at 40% of the download, Windows forces a restart to load the update, and it takes 20 minutes. Then Carla has to start the download again from the beginning. How long will it take her to download the file?

John drives for three hours at 60 miles per hour and then turns around because he realizes that he has forgotten something very important at home. He tries to get home for four hours but spends the first two hours in traffic. He spends the next half hour driving at 30 miles per hour, before he can drive the remaining four hours at 80 miles per hour. How far is he from home at the end of those four hours?
Eliza's hourly rate for the first 40 hours she works each week is $10. She also receives 1.2 times her regular hourly overtime pay. If Eliza worked 45 hours this week, what is her weekly earnings?
The number of downloads in the second month was three times the number of downloads in the first month, but it fell by 30% in the third month.
Toula went to the bakery and bought a variety of cookies: 3 dozen donuts for $68 each, 2 dozen cupcakes for $80 each, and 6 dozen cheesecakes for $55 each.

Carlos plants a lemon tree. It will cost $90 to plant. Each year it will produce seven lemons, which he can sell for $1.5 each. The cost of watering and feeding the tree each year is $3. How many years will it take before he starts to make a profit from the lemon?

Melanie is a door-to-door saleswoman. She sold one third of her vacuum cleaners in the green house, 2 more in the red house, and half of the rest in the orange house. If Melanie has 5 vacuum cleaners left, how many did she start with?
In a dance class of 20 students, 20% enrolled in modern dance, 25% in jazz, and the rest in the dance department. What percentage of all students enrolled in the dance department?

A trader wants to make a purchase choice between 2 purchase plans: jewelry worth $5,000 or electronics worth $8,000. His financial advisor estimates that the jewelry market will rise to 2.5% while the electronics market will rise to 1.2% within the same month. If the trader wants to have the highest profits by the end of this month by making an option, how much profit will this be?

Two trains have left San Rafael at the same time. They have started traveling westward, both traveling 80 miles. The next day, they travel northward, 150 miles. What is the distance the two trains traveled in the two days?
Jill is paid $20 an hour to coach and $30 an hour to coach the fans. If she works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher and 15 hours as a coach, what is her annual salary?
Claire prepares a three-egg omelet every morning during the feast. How many dozen eggs will she eat after 4 weeks?

Marissa walks a distance of 12 miles [12 km]. It took her 1 hour to walk the first 4 miles, then another hour to walk the next 2 miles. If she wants her average speed to be 4 miles per hour, what speed (in miles per hour) would she need to walk the rest of the way?

I have 10 liters of orange juice that is two thirds water and I would prefer to add it to 15 liters of pineapple juice that is three thirds water. But when I pour it, I have poured out one liter of orange juice. How much water is in the remaining 24 liters?
Raymond and Samantha are cousins. Raymond was born 6 years before Samantha. Raymond had a son at the age of 23. If Samantha is now 31 years old, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?

Billy sells DVDs. He has 8 customers on Tuesday. His first 3 customers buy one DVD each. His next 2 customers buy 2 DVDs each. His last 3 customers don't buy any DVDs. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?
A candle melts by about one inch [2 cm] for every hour it burns. How many inches will the candle shrink after it is lit from 7:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.?
Kyle bought last year's bestseller for $19.50. This was after receiving a 25% discount on the original price. What was the original price of the book?

Marie ordered one chicken meal for $12 (U.S.), five milk cartons for $3 (U.S.), four apples for $1.50 (U.S.), and some boxes of pizza. Marie paid a total of $50. How many boxes of pizza did Marie order if each box cost $8.50 (U.S.)?

Mishka bought 3 pairs of caps, 3 pairs of pants, and 3 pairs of shoes. A pair of caps is $16.50. A pair of pants is $22.50 and a pair of shoes is $42. How many dollars did Mishka spend on all the items of clothing he bought?
Cynthia eats one ice cream every night. She buys boxes of 15 ice cream for $4.00 each. After 60 days, how much money will she have spent on ice cream?
Henry stopped twice during his 60-mile bicycle trip - the first time at 20 miles and the second time with 15 miles to go.

When Gloria finds a pair of shoes that fits her budget, she buys them, but she must choose between the shoes and two pairs of high-heeled shoes that together cost less than the shoes by five dollars. If one pair of high-heeled shoes costs $33 and the other is twice the price, how much do the shoes cost?
If the sum of their present ages is 162, calculate Allen's age 10 years from now.

Gunter tries to count the candies in the big bottle. He asks his friends how many candies they think are in the big bottle. One says 80. Another says 20 more than half of what the first said. The third says 25% more than the first. What is their average guess?
John takes care of 10 dogs, each of which he spends .5 hours a day walking and handling. How many hours a week does he spend caring for them?
Gretchen has 110 coins. There are 30 gold coins more than silver coins. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?
Aaron has 5 more than half of Raymond's jewels. If Raymond has 40 jewels, how many jewels does Siobhan have?
Mike plays tennis for 40 minutes. In the first 20 minutes, he scores 4 points. In the second 20 minutes, he scores 25% more points. How many points did he score in total?
Terry drinks 2 cashew milk. There is currently an offer of 4 cashew milk for $5.00. How much does he spend on cashew milk over a 30-day period?

John plans to sell all his dolls and use the money to buy video games. He has 13 sets of Legos and sells them for $15 each. He manages to buy 8 video games for $20 each and is left with $5. How many sets of Legos does he have left?
John runs 60 miles a week. He runs 3 days a week. He runs 3 hours the first day and half that amount the next two days he runs. How fast does he run?

If Dana can run at four times her normal running speed, but can only jump at half her normal speed, if she can jump three miles per hour, how many miles can she travel in six hours if she spends one third of an hour running and two thirds of an hour walking?
Brandon's iPhone is four times older than Ben's iPhone. Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Suzy's iPhone. If Suzy's iPhone is 1 year old, how old is Brandon's iPhone?

The giant ape, Perg, lived on the highest point of Mount Farbo, most aggressive to anything within 1,000 feet. Polly was able to throw a golden spear, the only known weapon capable of reaching the ape, 400 feet, well within range of the ape's rays. But when Polly caught the jewel, she was able to throw the spear three times the distance when she was not holding the jewel. Holding the jewel, how much further beyond the ape's rays would Polly be able to stand and still hit the ape with the golden spear?

Mrs. Jones baked five apple cakes for the firefighter's chamcha. She cut each cake into eight pieces and placed five cakes on the catering table for guests to take away. By the end of the evening, after guests had taken and eaten their pieces, there were 14 pieces of cake left. How many pieces did the guests eat?

According to its nutrition facts sheet, a bag of chips has 250 calories per serving. If a 300-gram bag has 5 servings, how many grams can you eat if your daily calorie target is 2000 and you have already eaten 1,800 calories?

Charlie wants to sell beeswax candles. For every pound of beeswax, he can make 10 candles. A pound of beeswax and pasta all cost $10.00. If he sells each candle for $2.00 each, what would his total profit be by making and selling 20 candles?

Meredith is a freelance blogger who writes about health topics and submits them to clients every day as her full-time job. A blog post takes an average of 4 hours to research and write. Last week, she wrote 5 posts on Monday and Tuesday she wrote 2/5 more posts on Monday. Wednesday, she wrote twice as many posts as she did on Tuesday. Find the total number of hours she spent writing articles in those three days.

Candice put 80 sticker sheets in her purse before leaving for work at her coffee shop. On the way, she stopped at a store and bought a package of sticker sheets; at work, she put one sticker catalogue in 220 different coffee cups. If she had 23 sticker sheets left in total, how many sticker sheets were in the package she bought?
John buys red ties twice as much as blue ties. The red ties cost 50% more than the blue ties. He spent $200 on the blue ties, which cost $40 each. How much did he spend on the blue ties?
Tracy used a 4-foot-long (4 m) wire to hold tomato plants in the field, which was cut into 6-inch-long pieces.
Richard lives in a 15-story building with 8 apartments on each floor, and three quarters of the building is occupied.
Lloyd owns an egg farm. His hens lay 252 eggs a day and sell them for $2 a dozen. How much does Lloyd make from eggs each week?
Tom's boat can travel at 10 miles per hour. He sails from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. and then returns at 6 miles per hour. How long will it take him to get back?

Uriah's book bag becomes too heavy for him. He needs to remove 15 pounds from the bag. His futon books weigh 1/4 pound each and his dolls weigh 1/2 pound each. If he removes 30 futon books, how many dolls does he need to remove?

The mechanic charges different rates for repairing truck and car tires. For each truck tire that is repaired, the mechanic will charge $60 and for each car tire that is repaired, the mechanic will charge $40. On Thursday, the mechanic repaired 6 truck tires and 4 car tires. On Friday, the mechanic repaired 12 car tires and did not repair any truck tires. What is the extra income the mechanic earned on the day he earned the most?

Doubtfire's sisters drive home with 7 kittens they adopted from a local animal shelter and their mother calls them to tell them that two of their kittens have had kittens. She says that Patchy, the first cat, has three times as many kittens as the adopted ones, while Trixie, the other cat, has 12 kittens. How many kittens does the Doubtfire family now have?
Jean has 30 sweets. Jean eats 2 of those sweets. For the remaining sweets, Jean wants to put 2 sweets in one bag. How many bags can Jean fill?
Pete plans to go to the movies this week. He always gets a $7 ticket and a $7 bus. If he has $42 to spend in a week, how many times can he go to the movies?

A wooden bridge can carry no more than 5,000 pounds. A delivery truck filled with identical boxes, each box weighing 15 pounds, will pass over the bridge. The total weight of the driver and the empty truck is 3,755 pounds. What is the maximum number of boxes that can be loaded onto a truck without exceeding the weight limit of the bridge?

Stephen ordered the vegetables online. His final bill was $40.00. Because this was through a delivery vendor, they charged a 25% fee on his final total and charged him $3.00 as a delivery fee. Stephen also added $4.00 in commission. After the additional fees, what was the final price of Stephen's vegetables?
A cluster of raspberries has 6 clusters of 20 berries each and 67 berries scattered throughout the cluster.
A basket contains 25 oranges, of which 1 is rotten, 20% is unripe, 2 are fermented and the rest are good. How many oranges are good?
Janet buys her daughter a bra. She pays $500 for the fabric to make it and then another $800 to the jeweler to make it. After that, she pays 10% of that to insure it. How much did she pay in total?

Mercy, who has worked for the same company for 40 years, will receive an annual pension of $50,000 a year. After 20 years, she is entitled to 5% of the value of the pension annually. If she retires after 30 years, what will her annual pension be?

Aleena subscribed to a streaming service that charges her $140 a month. If the streaming company charged her that initial rate for the first half of the year and then charged her a reduced rate of 10% for the second half of the year, calculate the total amount she had paid for the streaming service at the end of the year.

Sophia is considering taking a trip in her own car, and she would like to know how far she can travel on one tank of gas. She has traveled 100 miles since her last filling, and she needs to add 4 gallons of gasoline to fill her tank again. Her car's manual says that her tank holds 12 gallons of gasoline. How many miles can Sophia drive on one tank of gasoline?

Jim spends two hours watching TV and then decides to go to bed and read a book for half that time. He does this three times a week. How many hours does he spend watching TV and reading a book in four weeks?

There are four schools competing in the basketball tournament. Each school has sent a girls' basketball team and a boys' basketball team and each team has 5 players. Each school has also sent a coach to each team. In total, how many people have all the schools sent?
A treasure hunter found a buried treasure trove full of gems: 175 diamonds, 35 rubles less than diamonds, and twice as many emeralds.
The number of boys at R. Wertz is twice as high as the number of girls. If there are 60 girls and 5 students for every student, how many teachers does the school have?
Bailey starts with a certain amount of money. Then he receives a weekly bonus of $5 for 8 weeks. At the end of 8 weeks, if he has a total of $100, how much money did Bailey start with?
Judy teaches 5 dance classes, daily, weekdays and 8 classes on Saturdays. If each class has 15 students and she charges $15.00 per student, how much money does she make in 1 week?
Kelian has two recipes, one with 20 recipes and the other with three times as many. How many recipes does Kelian need to read to prepare two meals?

Tommy makes his contribution by selling brown cakes for $3 per slice and cheesecakes for $4 per slice. Tommy sold 43 slices of brown cakes and 23 slices of cheesecake, how much money did Tommy contribute?
She bought five mobile phones for $150 each for a three-month installment. 2% interest will be charged on each phone. How much will Sheila pay monthly for 3 months?

Artie has a flower shop at the Farmers Market. He sells three types of flowers: marigolds, petunias, and begonias. He sells marigolds for $2.74 a bushel, petunias for $1.87 a bushel, and begonias for $2.12 a bushel. Artie has no minimum-value coins so he decides to keep all of his prices to about a dollar. If Artie sells 12 pots of marigolds, 9 pots of petunias, and 17 pots of begonias, how much money will he make?

Luke has been sitting on the beach building sand castles. Eventually he finds out that each level of the sand castle will have half a square foot of the level below it. If he builds a 4-level sand castle where the top level is 16 square feet, what is the average square foot of the level?

Cecilia has bought a puppy. According to her veterinarian, she needs to feed the puppy 1 cup of dog food every day for the first 180 days. Then she needs to feed the puppy 2 cups of dog food every day for the rest of her life. If one bag of dog food contains 110 cups, how many bags of dog food will Cecilia use in the first year?

If Raymond does half as much laundry as Sarah does, and Sarah does 4 times as much laundry as David does, calculate the difference in the amount of laundry Raymond and David do for Sarah, if Sarah washes 400 pounds of laundry.
Vincent can buy flowers in 3 packages for $2.50 or in 2 packages for $1. How much money does he save by buying 18 flowers at the best price?
John takes the dog. He takes the dog to a groomer, for $100. The groomer gives him a 30% discount as a new customer. How much will the grooming cost him?
Two girls each got 1/6 of a quart of water, then the boy got 6 quarts.

Charlie had 10 stickers. He bought 21 stickers from a store in a department store and got 23 for his birthday. Then Charlie gave his sister 9 stickers and used 28 to decorate a greeting card. How many stickers does Charlie have left?
Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex's weight is 2 pounds by 4 times Grace's weight. What is their total weight per pound?
Dan plants 3 rose bushes. Each rose bush has 25 roses, each rose has 8 thorns. How many thorns are there in total?
The football team played 22 games, won 8 more than they lost.

Gene sews a T-shirt from old commemorative shirts. He has one shirt from each holiday he's ever been on. Each shirt is a large side of his T-shirt. Each row is made up of large sides from a different holiday year. He goes on four vacations a year and has been going on vacations since he was 23. He's now 34. How many large sides of his T-shirt does he have in total?

Greg has set an alarm to go off three times a day as a reminder. When the alarm goes off, it goes off until Greg turns it off. The first time it went off today, it went off four times. The second time it went off, it went off three times more than the first time it went off. The third time it went off, it went off half as much as the second time it went off. How many times did the alarm go off in total?

The company pays each of its employees $600 a month. The company has a policy of increasing the salaries of each employee by 10% of the initial salary each year for those who have been with the company for five years. If Sylvie completed 5 years in the company last December, what is her annual salary after three more years of service to the company?
Marilyn's first record sold 10 times as many copies as Harald's, but if they sold 88,000 copies, how many did Harald sell?

Christina is planning a birthday party and needs .75 gift bags for each guest invited, because 1/4 of the attendees did not attend. She invited 16 friends. Gift bags are $2 each. How much will she spend?

Ted the T-Rex was planning to deliver a potato chip to the dinosaur park. He knows that the adult dinosaur will eat 10 pounds of potato chip, and the baby will eat half as much as the adult. If there are 20 adults and 5 children in the park, how many pounds of potato chip does Ted need to bring to the park if he expects to feed each dinosaur?
Jani has three times as many pets as Marcia. Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. If Cindy has four pets, what is the total number of pets of these three people?

Emily has four children known as Amy, Jackson, Corey, and James. Ami is 5 years older than Jackson and 2 years younger than Corey. If James is 10 years old and Corey is 1 year younger, how old is Jackson?

Lee was able to run the 400-meter hurdles two seconds faster than Gerald would have been able to run the 400-meter hurdles. But Gerald changed his diet, which improved his speed by 10 percent. If Lee runs the 400-meter hurdles in 38 seconds, how many seconds can Gerald, with his improved diet, run the 400-meter hurdles?

In a neighborhood, the number of rabbits is less than a dozen for the total number of dogs and cats. If there are two cats for every dog, and the number of dogs is 60, how many pets are there in total in that neighborhood?
Of the 200 students in Grade 5, 2/5 are boys and 2/3 are girls in Girl Scouts. How many girls are not in Girl Scouts?
Harry slept for nine hours last night. His friend James slept only two-thirds of the hours that Harry slept. How many hours did Harry sleep more than James?

When Freda cooks canned tomato sauce, they lose half their volume. Each 16-ounce can of tomatoes she uses has three tomatoes. Freda's last package of tomato sauce produced 32 ounces of tomato sauce. How many tomatoes did Freda use?

Cars line up on the road. Some of them pass in the first 15 minutes of traffic, then 20 more pass in the remaining 15 minutes of traffic. 5 cars from the queue leave the main road to avoid being run over by traffic. If there were 30 cars on the road before, how many cars passed in the first 15 minutes?

Mary is an avid gardener. Yesterday, she received 18 potted plants from her favorite nursery. She already has 2 potted plants on each of her 40 window frames in her large country cottage. Out of generosity, she has decided that tomorrow she will give 1 potted plant from each frame to friends and family. How many potted plants will Mary have left?

Jerome had four friends who came to visit him one day. The first friend rang the doorbell 20 times before Jerome opened it, the second friend rang the doorbell 1/4 times more than Jerome's first friend, the third friend rang the doorbell 10 times more than the fourth friend. If the fourth friend rang the doorbell 60 times, how many times did the doorbell ring?

Solo is required to read 4 pages from his Science textbook, 20 pages from his Social Studies textbook, 7 pages from his History textbook and 8 pages from his Geography textbook. Solo read 15 pages on Monday. If he has 4 more days to complete all the pages of reading, on average how many pages does he need to read per day?

John likes to drink a glass of water during the break, the snack and the recharge. Finally, he drinks a glass of water before going to bed. John does this every day of the week, but on weekends he likes to relax and drink soda instead of water during the recharge. How many glasses of water does John drink per week?

A mist mound rises from the sea and covers the city, taking 10 minutes to cover every 3 miles [3.5 km]. If the city is 42 miles [42 km] wide from the coast to the other side of the mainland, how many minutes would it take for the mist to cover the entire city?
Poppy solves a puzzle of 1,000 pieces, one-quarter of which she can put on the board, and then her mother can put on one-third of the remaining pieces.
Cody eats three times as many cookies as Amir does. If Amir eats 5 cookies, how many cookies do they both eat together?
John has 3 boxes, each box being 5 by 6 by 4 inches, with walls 1 inch thick. What is the total space inside all 3 boxes?

Frankie watches TV after his overtime every night. On Monday and Tuesday, he watched a 1-hour episode of his favorite movie every night. On Wednesday, he watched a few 30-minute episodes. On Thursday, he finished his overtime early and watched a 1-hour and 30-minute episode. On Friday, he stayed up for the weekend, so he watched two 1-hour episodes. If he watched 7 hours of television in total, how many 30-minute episodes did he watch on Wednesday?

Henry is baking cookies for a local baking competition. He wants to make twice as many as he did last year. When he finishes baking, he finds that he has baked 15 more cookies than he expected. 5 cookies fell out while he was putting them away to dry, and now he has a total of 110 cookies. How many cookies did Henry bake last year?
The software company gives a cashback of $.20 per gallon if you add fuel to this station. If someone buys 10 gallons of fuel, how much will their fuel be after the cashback rewards?

Marcell and Beatrice are competing to see who can eat the most of the fruit, so they know how much they can get. Unfortunately, one makes a mistake - Beatrice's fruit is 2 inches wide by 24 inches long, while Marcel's is 3 inches wide by 14 inches long. If both of them ate all the fruit, how much did they eat on average?

Julia's boat began to leak while she was on the lake. The boat was taking in two liters of water for every ten feet she pulled the canoe back to shore. It took her sixteen seconds to row twenty feet. The shore was 64 seconds away. How much water had the boat taken in by the time Julia reached the shore?

A classroom has a whiteboard shared among 4 teachers who use the classroom in shifts. Each teacher has 2 lessons per day and uses the whiteboard in each lesson. If the whiteboard is erased 3 times per lesson, how many times per day is the whiteboard erased?
Ryan plants two flowers a day in his garden, and after 15 days, how many flowers will he have if five flowers are not in bloom?

Jamal's phone can hold 6 times more pictures than Brittany's phone. The maximum number of pictures Brittany's phone can hold is 50 times the number of birds in Jamal's picture of ducks in a wildlife park. If Jamal's phone can hold 1800 pictures, how many ducks can be seen in Jama's picture of ducks in a wildlife park?

Sasha has discovered that the price of logs has gone up by 50% in the last few months after buying more logs. Since she has the remaining ones, she decides to sell them. She has ten pieces of 2 x 4 x 10 that cost her $10 each. She also has five pieces of 4 x 4 x 10 that she bought for $16 each.
Katy makes coffee with a ratio of 7:13 of teaspoons of sugar to cups of water. If she used a total of 120 teaspoons of sugar and cups of water, count the number of teaspoons of sugar she used.
John buys 2 pairs of shoes for each of his 3 children. They cost $60 each. How much did he pay in total?

A customs officer at the main SeaSide inspection port counted 2 containers of imported vehicles, each containing 5 vehicles. The next day, more containers were brought in, bringing the total number of vehicles in the port to 30.

Adrien's total salary was 30 percent more than Lulah's. Four years later, her salary had increased, and she was making 40% more than she was making four years earlier. If Adrien and Lylah's salaries were equal, and Adrien was making $40,000 four years earlier, how many times the total salary that the two people were making four years later?
Miguel uses 2 sheets of paper a week in his painting. If there are 30 sheets of paper in one sheets of paper, how many sheets of paper does he use each month?
Morisette brought five apples and eight oranges, while Kael brought twice as many apples and half as many oranges as Morisette.

Sadie slept 8 hours on Monday. For the next two days, she slept 2 hours each, because she needed to complete her extra work. If the rest of the week she slept 1 hour more than those two days, how many hours did she sleep in total for the whole week?
Rosie can run 10 miles per hour for three hours straight, then she can run 5 miles per hour. How many miles can she run in 7 hours?

Jennie, who helps in her mother's office, has a draft of 60 letters that need to be stamped, and a draft of letters that already have stamps. She stamps one third of the letters that need to be stamped. If there are now 30 letters in the draft, how many letters were in the draft before Jennie started?

Julia was hosting a dinner party at her house, where she had intended to serve soup to the guests. She noticed that her plastic spoons had run out, so she bought a new pack of spoons. Later, her husband also bought a pack of 5 new spoons and gave them to Julia. While Julia was preparing the soup, she used three of all the spoons to taste her soup. Later, when she went to set the table, she had a total of 12 spoons.

Dylan needed a sausage and a fish sausage to prepare the sausage sauce for the party. He bought 38 chicken sausages and 6 fish sausages more than chicken sausages. How many sausages did Dylan buy in total?
After moving to a new school, Amy had 20 more friends than Lily. If Lily had 50 friends, how many friends do Lily and Amy have in total?

Mrs. Wells sells raisins, peppers, and oranges at a local store. The price of the raisins is three times the price of the peppers. The price of the raisins is five times the price of the oranges. Dillon is sent to the store to buy four raisins, 20 peppers, and 10 oranges. How much money will he spend in total if the price of the peppers is $15?

The hospital serves 500 people a day. Each patient is treated for an average of 24 minutes. Doctors charge the hospital $150 an hour and the hospital charges the patients $200 an hour. How much money does the hospital make from these trips?

Nissa hires 60 seasonal workers to play Elf in the Santa village of her department store. A third of them leave after the children have cooked for them, then 10 of the remaining leave after the children have kicked them. How many are left?
Joseph's expenditure in May was $500. In June, his expenditure was down by $60. What was the total of his expenditure for the two months?

Pam and Fred went to the carnival. Pam rode the roller coaster twice, Fred four times, and then each decided to ride the roller coaster twice. If each ride cost six tickets, how many tickets did both of them use that day?

On Monday, Walt walked four miles. On Tuesday, he walked six times as many miles as he had walked on Monday. The total of miles he walked Monday through Wednesday was 41 miles. How many miles did he walk on Wednesday?
Tom gets his car washed 4 times a month. If he pays $15 for each car wash, how much does he pay for a car wash a year?
Brian's friend Bobby has 5 video games that are less than 3 times Brian's video games. If Brian has 20 video games but lost 5 before the comparison was made, how many video games does Bobby have?
There are only 27 horses left in the world. One third of them are in the Scottish Highlands. Two thirds of the French Scots are female. How many Scottish females are there?

Rory has ordered 2 sandwiches for $7.50 each, 2 bags of chips for $1.50 each and 2 cookies for $1.00 each. There is a 20% delivery fee added at checkout and she wants to add a $5.00 deposit. How much will it cost in total?

Mark did a 75-question exercise yesterday, completing it at a rate of 5 questions per hour. Today, he did another 100-question exercise at the same rate. If Mark had 8 hours to complete the first exercise and 6 hours to complete the second, how many questions did he leave unfinished?
In the candy machine, there are 22 pink candies, four times as many as there are blue ones. If there are 12 blue ones, how many pink ones are there?
Of the 20 vehicles available for rent, 12 are automatic, 4 are manual, and the rest are semi-automatic.
There are 700 bees in a hive. The number of worker bees is twice as many as the number of queen bees, and the number of queen bees is three times as many as the number of queen bees.
Jordan plays video games for two hours a day and works part-time for $10 an hour. How much money would Jordan make in a week if he spent his time playing video games working?
John buys milk for $2, eggs for $3, light bulbs for $3, cups for $3, and bug traps for $4. If there is a 10% tax on all nonfood items, what was the total cost?

Kim has started her own home cleaning business and calculates the profit she will make from the customers. She already has 3 customers, but she is talking to 5 others and feels brave enough to add them to her calculations. Each customer's house will require 2 bottles of chlorine and one pack of wiping cloths. The chlorine bottles are $2 each and the cloth packs will cost $5 each. These are her only consumption costs. She calculates that her total income for the week will be $92. The profit is the difference between total income and total consumption costs, so how much profit, in dollars, will Kim make per week?
John has a ten-hectare pineapple farm, with 100 pineapples per acre, and he can harvest his pineapple every three months.

Johnny picks up dolls from the floor of his room. He had thrown a box of 500 Lego bricks on the floor, another with three times as many, and another with a quarter of the number. How many Lego bricks would Johnny pick up if he picked up all the Lego bricks?

Debra tracks the hive to see how many bees come in and out of it in a day. She sees 30 bees leave the hive in the first 6 hours, and then sees half that number of bees come back in the next 6 hours. She sees twice as many bees as she saw leave the first time, jump out of the hive and out of the next 6 hours. Then each bee that left before that comes back in the next 6 hours. How many bees did Debra see return to the hive in the last 6 hours of the day?

Brittany and her mother go to the costume shop. Admission is $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's mother pays for 1 child and 1 adult ticket. If she was returned $8, how much, in dollars, had she paid?

Charlie has three times as many friends as Dorothy's friends on Facebook. James has four times as many friends as Dorothy's friends on Facebook. If Charlie has 12 friends on Facebook, how many friends does James have on Facebook?

Steve and Tim decided to see who could get home from school faster. Steve lives farther away than Tim, so he was allowed to ride his bike. Steve lives 3 miles from school and can ride his bike at 440 feet per minute. Tim lives 2 miles from school. If Tim can use his skateboard at 264 feet per minute, how long will the winner wait at home before the loser gets to their house?

Shawnda has decided that the kids in her neighborhood can actually use the bike air service. She decides the best way to charge is per tire. Each tire costs 25 cents to air. On the first day, 5 people on a bike came to get air on both their tires each. 3 people came to get air on their three tires each. Finally, one person came on a one-wheeled bike. How much did he make that day?
Carl buys ten packs of cookies. Each packet contains six cookies. Each cookie costs $0.10. How much money will Carl get back if he pays with a $10 bill?

Dave bought a large package of chips and ate fourteen before his hungry uncle stole the package from his hand. When the uncle landed, he baked half of the chips Dave had eaten. Then three pigeons chased him from the food, and each dove ate three chips. Later, a raccoon stole two-thirds of the remaining chips. The raccoons carried the last chip, leaving five behind. How many chips were in the package when Dave bought it?

On Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, Kimo, a college student, has three 1-hour classes each day. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, he has two 2-hour classes each day. In one semester, there are 16 weeks of school. In one semester, how many hours does Kimo spend attending classes?

Bill bakes 300 sconces, 120 chocolate croissants, and 60 bagels a day - each one 4 inches long, each croissant 6 inches long, and each bagel 2 feet high. If Bill were to line all these items up, how many feet would that line be?

A zookeeper feeds all the monkeys in the zoo, ordering all the bananas from a local farm every two months. If monkeys need 200 bananas, chimpanzees 400, and humans 100 a month, how many are needed for 2 months?

Blake and Kelly compete to see who can run the longest in 15 minutes. They decide to compete on a 100-yard football field. Blake runs back and forth 15 times. Kelly runs back and forth once, and then decides she doesn't want to run next to Blake, so she starts running back and forth to the 40-yard line. She does this 34 times. How much further did the winner run than the loser?
Raphael went out to buy some school supplies: 4 pens for $1.5 each, 2 notebooks for $4 each, and a roll of paper for $20. How much did Raphael spend on each item?
Finn watches 11 frog babies swimming in a pool, then sees 6 emerge from under the lilies, and then 2 of them hide under a rock. How many frog babies can Finn see in the pool at this point?
The water tank is 17 feet deep on Monday. On Tuesday, the tank is 7 feet deeper. On Wednesday, the water tank is two-thirds as deep as it was on Tuesday. How deep is the water tank on Sunday?

Anakin and Locsin went ashore today. Anakin caught 10 octopuses, 6 seahorses, and 3 seahorses, while Locsin caught 5 octopuses less than Anakin, 3 seahorses less than Anakin, and 2 seahorses more than Anakin. How many fish did they both catch in total?
If the price of a marble bag is $20 and that price increases by 20% of the original price every two months, what will the price of the marble bag be after 36 months?

In the room, there are various toys: 5 red cars, 3 weapons, and a doll. The cost of one doll is the same as that of 3 weapons and one red car is $4. How much does all the toys cost, if one weapon costs $5?

Jackie is trying to decide whether to do her taxes herself or find an accountant. If she does her taxes herself, she will be able to do 3 hours of her freelance work, losing $35 an hour. The accountant charges her $90. How much money will she save if she gives the accountant the job?

For her 30th birthday, Elvira chose a new computer with more features as a gift. She has a budget of 1,500 euros donated by her entire family and thinks she can save enough money to buy clothes. She goes to a computer store and chooses a machine with a screen, keyboard, and mouse that costs 1,090 euros. She also buys a laptop for 157 euros, a tape recorder for 74 euros, and a printer for 102 euros. How much money will she have left to buy her clothes?

Sandra's neighbor gives her a basket of 9 eggs every time she is their daughter's nanny. To make a Spanish cake, she needs 3 eggs. If Sandra is assigned to make 15 Spanish cakes for a fund-raiser at her school, how many times will Sandra have to be nanny?
Seth is twice as old as Brooke. In two years, they will be 28 years old. How old is Seth?
If Ethel has $8, how much money does Jimmy have?
Pancho walks 20 miles a day. Except on weekends when he walks 10 miles. How many miles does he walk in total per week?
A marching band orders a new uniform, each with a cap that costs $25, a jacket that costs three times as much, and a pair of pants that cost about half the price of the hat and jacket.
As Jake walks through the Entomology Museum, he sees 80 eight-legged spiders, 90 six-legged insects, and 3 unusual animals with 10 legs each.

There are four birds in Caboose. Sally Two is three years older than Granny Red. Granny Red is twice as old as Sally Four. If Sally Four is the same age as Sally Thirtytwo, and Sally Thirtytwo is 8 years old, what is the total age of these four birds?

Jessica is trying to figure out how much she can pay off each month. Her student loans have a monthly minimum payment of $300, her credit cards have a monthly minimum payment of $200, and her mortgage has a monthly minimum payment of $500. If Jessica wants to pay 50% more than the minimum, how much does she pay off in a year?

Billy is peeling and cutting potatoes in preparation for making potato salad for the roast meat for his big family gathering. It's a big event, so he has 60 potatoes to handle. Potatoes are about the same size, so it takes about a minute to peel and cut each one. It takes Billy a minute and a half to peel potatoes, but only 5 seconds to cut them. How long will it take Billy to finish preparing the potatoes?

Juan and his brother Carlos sell lemon juice. Each gallon they make costs them $3 for lemon and $2 for sugar. They sell each glass for $0.50 and a gallon carries 20 glasses. If they made a profit of $25, how much did they spend on the lemon?
In a race with 240 Asians, 80 were Japanese, and the rest were Chinese. If the number of boys on the Chinese team was 60, how many girls were on the Chinese team?

Zaid spends 1/4 of his salary on rent, 1/3 on car fuel and the other half on his favorite stock. He gives his daughter $200 to spend on weekly expenses and gives his wife $700 to buy vegetables and other household items. If Zaid is paid $6,000 a month, how much money will he have left after all the expenses and donations?
Rani has ten more shrimp than Monic, who has four fewer shrimp than Bo. If Bo has 40, multiply the total number of shrimp that the three men have.
Lloyd earns $10 an hour teaching Mathematics. The first week he teaches for five hours, the second week for eight hours. How much did he earn in the first two weeks?

Two candidates are running for class representative at Sarai School. If the winner got 3/4 of the votes and the total number of students voting in the class was 80, count the number of votes the loser got.

Sandra, a flower seller nearby, is upset that Fred has not completed the delivery of the order. Sandra had ordered four times as many red roses as white ones. She also ordered 200 pink lilies, which were five times as many white ones. Sandra has threatened to change suppliers if the missing red roses are not delivered by 11 p.m. To keep Sandra's business going, how many red roses must Fred have delivered by 11 p.m.?
Jean is two years older than Mark. Two years ago Mark was five years older than Jan. If Jan is 30, how old is Jean?

Two track teams compete against each other in a 4x400-meter relay race; a race in which each team has four members who each run 400 meters, or one lap, on a full course. One of the two teams has the best runners and each of them will run their 400-meter course in 55 seconds. The other team has no good runners; their first runner will run their 400-meter course in 60 seconds and then each runner will be 3 seconds faster than the one before them. Using these information, which team with the fastest run will win by how many seconds?
Jerry is playing a six-sided die. Is there a greater probability (in percent) that he rolls a big number by 3 than he rolls two odd numbers twice in a row?
Jenna and her mother picked apples from their apple orchard, but Jenna picked half as many as her mother did. If her mother got 20, how many apples did they each pick?

Russell works in a pet store and distributes tubes among the rodents. The mice are placed in 3 pens in groups of 6 tubes each. There are 10 pencil pens that are separately placed and each pencil is given 5 tubes. There is also a bunch of rabbits where 20 tubes are distributed among the rabbits. No tubes were used elsewhere in the store. If 160 pencil pens were distributed among the rodents, how many rats are there in each pen?
Mendy owes $100 to Benedict. They agreed to a monthly interest of 2%. If Mendy could pay after 3 months, how much should he give Benedict?

The seller buys bags of wheat flour from the farmer for $20 a bag. If the cost of transporting each bag from the field to the warehouse is $2, and the seller made a total profit of $400 after selling all the bags at $30 a bag, how many bags did he sell?

Three friends spent $20.25 on three show tickets. They also bought food, and the ticket price was $4.50 higher than the food. They also went on two separate trips for $33 each. If they agreed to split all the expenses equally, how much did each of them pay?
John collects peaches in three hours. He can collect 2 peaches in one minute. How many peaches will he collect in total?
Ducks need to eat about two pounds [3.5 kg] of insects each week to survive. If there is a flock of ten ducks, how many pounds of insects do they eat in total per day?
Tom plants 10 trees a year. He also cuts down 2 trees a year. He starts with 50 trees. After 10 years, 30% of the trees die. How many trees does he have left?

On Friday morning, the neighbors put 18 pink plastic flamingos in Sue's front yard. On Saturday morning, the neighbors removed one third of the flamingos, painted them white, and then returned the painted flamingos to Sue's front yard. Then, on Sunday morning, they added 18 more pink plastic flamingos to the collection.
Violetta wants to buy new crayons. She needs 5 different colors and has $20 to make this purchase. One crayon costs $2. How much will she get back?
The pencil costs $1.20 and the towel $0.30 - how much will 8 pens cost?
A city of 40 restaurants would receive 200 pounds of carrots, each of which would receive 2 pounds.
In the city of Soda, there are 23786 inhabitants, including 8417 men and 9092 women. The rest of the population are children. How many children are there in the city of Soda?

Elaine started with 20 Pokemon cards. After a month, she collected three times that number. In the second month, her collection was less than 20 cards. In the third month, she collected twice as many Pokemon cards as she had in the first and second months. How many Pokemon cards does she have now?

Mark is a copy editor. He edits the same number of sentences each week for two different publishers, each of whom pays him at a different rate per sentence. Publisher B pays Mark twice what Publisher A pays him. Mark edits a total of 1000 sentences each week, and Publisher A pays him 5 cents per sentence. How much money does Mark make per week, per cent?
Baldur draws water from a well, drawing five buckets each morning and six buckets each afternoon. If each bucket contains five liters of water, how many liters of water does he draw each day?

John wins a prize at work. The prize consists of a one-time cash prize of $5000 and a 5% salary increase. If his weekly salary is $2000 and he won the prize on the first day of the year, how much money did he make in total that year?
Josie's vineyard covers 10 acres [1.4 ha], and each acre produces 5 tons of grapes a year, with each ton of grapes producing 2 barrels of wine.

Carl's favorite food is cheese. He ate a sandwich every day this week at lunch and used 2 slices of cheese on each sandwich. He ate cheese and egg omelets at lunch 3 days of the week and one omelet had one more slice of cheese than in his sandwich. He prepared a large meal of macaroni and cheese to fit several dishes for the week and used 8 slices of cheese on that meal. How many slices of cheese did he use in total?
Janet had 22 green and 10 yellow pens, then she bought 6 bags of blue and 2 bags of red pens - 9 in each blue bag and 6 in each red bag - and now she had a total of how many pens?

Brinley is in Mr. Bert's math class. Mr. Bert gives six exercises each semester. He allows students to subtract the lowest score from the average of the results each semester. If Brinley has scores of 89, 71, 92, 100 and 86 for the first five exercises, how many points does he need to get in the sixth exercise to have an average of 93?

Michael loves to ride a bike. He rode at least 5 times a week and went 25 miles a time. He did this for four weeks, and then decided to cycle only 2 times a week, but for 60 miles each time, and did this for 3 weeks. How many miles did Michael do in total?

Joe's bag of Halloween candy contains 25 chocolate candies and 80 apple candies. Each chocolate candy weighs twice as much as an apple candy. If each chocolate candy weighs 40 grams, how much does Joe's bag of candy weigh in total, in grams?

Rose went to the store on Monday and bought four cakes. On Tuesday she went to a different store and bought three times as many cakes as she had bought on Monday. On Wednesday she went to another store and bought five times as many cakes as she had bought on Tuesday. How many cakes did she buy in total over the three days?
The cost of twenty dozen cups is a little over $1,200 for the total cost of half a dozen plates sold for $6,000 each.

Sara wants to buy herself a new jacket and 2 pairs of shoes. The jacket she wants is $30 and each pair of shoes is $20. Sara checks on her neighbor's kids 4 times, and gets $5 for each check. Her parents pay her $4 for each time she mows the lawn. If Sara already had $10 in savings before she started checking on the neighbor's kids, how many times will she need to mow the lawn before she can afford the jacket and shoes?

Jerry has a flock of chickens. The red hen produces 3 eggs a day, and the white hen produces 5 eggs a day. Each day Jerry collects 42 eggs. If he has two more white chickens than red chickens, how many red chickens does he have?
Gary enjoys walking along the edge of the park, which is rectangular in shape and measures about one mile by six miles. If he walks three miles an hour, how long does it take him to walk?

At the dollar store, Sloane counts 100 customers entering the store, and the next day, he counts 50 more than the first day. If the total number of customers by the third day was 500, how many customers did he count on the third day?

Jerry has two pools, both with leaks of 4 gallons per minute. Four minutes ago, the large pool had twice the amount of water in the small pool. Now the large pool has four times the amount of water in the small pool. How much water does the small pool have now?
Lori wants to buy a pair of shoes for $320 and a matching belt for $32. Her part-time job pays her $8.00 an hour. How many hours will she have to work before she can make the purchase?
If she pays $165 a month for 12 months, how much balance will be left over by then?
There are 4 roses in a vase. There are 7 more dalia than roses in the vase. How many flowers are there in total in the vase?
Adrian is three times older than Harriet, and Harriet is half as old as Zack. Calculate the average age of all three after three years if Harriet's present age is 21.
Four students scored a total of 251 points in the board game, Naomi scoring 68 points, Yuri scoring 10 points, or more than half the points, and Brianna scoring 17 points, or more than Naomi.

It takes Carmen 10 minutes to solve a panda word puzzle and 5 minutes to solve a sudoku puzzle. Over the weekend she solved 3 panda word puzzles and 8 sudoku puzzles. How much time did she spend playing these games in total?

The water tank is filled with 120 liters of water. Celine used 90 liters of the water from the tank to irrigate her field. Then she was able to draw twice as much rainwater as was left over. How many liters of water are there now in the tank?
Andy has planted 90 geraniums and 40 more little purples. How many flowers has he planted in total?

Companies spend $15,000 on advertising a year, and then spend a third of that amount on advertising the next year. What is the total amount of money that company spent on advertising during those two years?

Carlos and Benji are on the beach. Carlos rents a boat for $30 an hour and Benji rents a banana boat for $18 an hour. If Carlos uses his boat for 3 hours and Benji uses his for 5 hours, how much will both of them pay in total?

Andrew plans a trip from New Jersey to Rochester. It takes 6 days to travel by bus and half of that time to travel by car from New Jersey to Rochester. How many days will he travel if he plans to go to Rochester by bus and back from Rochester by car?

James counts his Pokemon cards. He has 30 types of fire, 20 types of grass, and 40 types of water. If he loses 8 types of water and buys 14 types of grass, what percentage of the chance of picking up the corresponding card of the water type will be (in near perfect numbers)?

Chad ordered a homemade barbecue for lunch. The lowest barbecue is $6.50. He adds extra meat for $2.00, extra cheese for $1.00, $1.00 of garlic and 2 sauces for $0.25 each. Then he decides to enhance his meal for $3.00 in addition to adding a snack and a drink. Here's a $5.00 gift card he uses to pay. How much money does he still owe?

Callie is working on a 360-piece puzzle with her mother. Callie can usually add 4 pieces per minute. Her mother can basically do half of what Callie can do in a minute. How many hours will it take them to complete the puzzle?

The field produced 120 ticks. Ashlyn went to the field after two months and found that 30% of the ticks were ready to harvest, so she harvested them and brought them home. When she returned two weeks later, 3/4 of the remaining ticks were ready, so she harvested them. How many ticks were not ready to harvest after those two weeks?
Mark buys 12 cars from his company. Each car sells for $20,000. He pays 10% tax on those cars and then $1000 registration fee for each of them. What is the total amount he paid for everything?

Kylie and Robert enjoy going to the beach to collect trophies. On Monday, Kylie collects 5 more trophies than Robert, who collected 20. On Tuesday, Kylie collects twice as many trophies as he did on Monday. How many trophies did Kylie collect on Tuesday?
Dax went to their farm to pick apples and ants - half the number of ants in the field. If there were 50 ants, count all the insects in the field.
Thirty - six of them sunbathe in the snow, a third of them jump and swim in the sea, a third of them go into a cave to eat their evening meal, and a third of them go to the sea to swim.

Steve decides to start eating more tomatoes and decides to plant his own tomatoes. He eats twice as much as his fiance. He eats 6 a day. If one tomato tree can produce 3 tomatoes a week, how many tomato trees does he need?

John orders a pizza to share with his friends. There are 20 friends in total, and John needs to make sure that each one gets 4 slices. The pizza is sold in 8 slices only. How many pizzas does John need to order?
Ram uses a lot of pens. He discovered that he could save money by combining five empty pens into one pen. If he bought 25 and then used them to make a new pen, how many pens would he have left?
Johnny took his $20 bonus and added an extra $10 to it. Then he invested the sum, which tripled year after year. How much money did he have after one year?
Mary is two years younger than Joan, Joan is five years older than Jessa. If Jessa is 20, what is the total age of these three girls?

The hall had three doors, A, B, and C, for entrance and exit. If after the meeting 30 percent of the students left the building through door A, 3/5 of the rest through door B, and the rest through door C, count the number of students who left through door C.
James has 6 more candies than Robert. John has twice as many candies as Robert. If John has 54 candies, how many candies does John have more than James?
Dolly has two books. Pandora has one. If Dolly and Pandora read each other's books and theirs together, how many books will they have read by the end?

Mike had 5 friends. He stopped being friends with 2 of them. They send each other 2 letters a week and they are 5 pages long. He responds generously. He can write a page in 6 minutes. How many hours does he spend writing letters a week?

Jason has a 1,000-minute phone plan every month. He calls his client for 15 minutes a day, and he's talked to 300 other people this month. How many minutes does Jason have left if this month is 30 days long?

Griffin had 24 chips, but Kyle took 5. Billy took twice as many as Kyle. Ginger gave Griffin several chips, and then Colby took from Griffin 3 fewer chips than Kyle had taken. If Griffin had 27 chips, how many chips did Ginger give Griffin?

There are 4 snails in one tangasama and 32 in the other tangasama. The difference between the number of snails in these two tangasama is twice as much as the number of fish in both tangasama. If both tangasama have the same number of fish, how many fish are in each tangasama?

Jean's makeup artist charges $250 per hour. She needs expensive makeup for the film she's making and it takes 6 hours to make every day and she needs it done 4 times a week. The film takes 5 weeks to complete. After the film is finished the makeup artist gives Jean a 10% discount because of the amount of work she did. How much did Jean pay her?

Isabelle bought party supplies for her younger sister's birthday party. She spent $12 on cake ingredients, $43 on birthday gifts, $15 on decorations, $4 on invitations, and $22 on gift bags for guests. She divides the cost equally between her two parents. How much did each of them pay?
The cook bought four bags of onions, each weighing 50 pounds [50 kg].

On Monday, Sue ate 4 times as many cookies as her sister. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. Her brother ate 5 cookies on Monday and 13 the next day. If 1 cookie has 200 calories, how many calories did Sue eat more than her sister?
